Creator: D. Fournier, ADMB Project
Notes: Automatic differentiation makes it well suited to complex minimization problems

Creator: SoftIntegration
Notes: C/C++ based numerical computing and graphical plotting

Creator: MadArtSoft Ltd.
Notes: Numeric computation for business featuring. import data from any data source. Cube OLAP, generate reports, predictions, forecasts.

Creator: DSP Development
Notes: Numeric computations for science and engineering featuring a spreadsheet like interface.

Creator: Dyalog Ltd.
Notes: A modern dialect of APL, enhanced with features for functional and object-oriented programming.

Creator: R. Grothmann
Notes: Also a computer algebra system through interface with Maxima

Creator: M. Wojdyr
Notes: interactive graphics, scriptable, specialized in curve fitting and peak fitting, 2D only

Creator: Samit Basu
Notes: Codeless interface to external C, C++, and Fortran code.  Mostly compatible with MATLAB.

Creator: WaveMetrics
Notes: interactive graphics, programmable, 2D/3D, used for science and engineering, large data sets.

Creator: Jsoftware
Notes: online access to: J Application Library (JAL)

Creator: AMS
Notes: mathematics, interactive graphics 2D/3D, scriptable, used for science and engineering, very large data sets, desktop or client/server, open Java framework

Creator: Jeff Bezanson, Stefan Karpinski, Viral B. Shah, and other contributors
Notes: Open source language and environment for scientific computing. Direct calls of C functions from code (no wrappers or special APIs needed). Designed for cloud parallel computing in mind with LLVM JIT as a backend. Lightweight "green" threading (coroutines). Efficient support for Unicode. Powerful shell-like capabilities for managing other processes. Lisp-like macros and other metaprogramming facilities.

Creator: National Instruments
Notes: Graphical and textual (.m file script) programming approaches

Creator: MathWorks
Notes: Numerical computation and simulation with extended 2D/3D visualization.

Creator: MIT Project MAC and Bill Schelter et al.
Fredrik Johansson and others
Notes: A Python library for floating-point arithmetic, special function evaluation, and other numerical algorithms

Creator: Marc Schellens
Notes: Aimed as a drop-in replacement for IDL/PV-WAVE

Creator: John W. Eaton
Notes: General numerical computing package with lots of extension modules. Syntax mostly compatible with MATLAB

Creator: OriginLab
Notes: Integrated data analysis graphing software for science and engineering.  Flexible multi-layer graphing framework. 2D, 3D and statistical graph types. Built-in digitizing tool. Analysis with auto recalculation and report generation. Built-in scripting and programming languages.

Creator: Karl Glazebrook
Notes: Used for astrophysics, solar physics, oceanography, biophysics, and simulation. 2D plotting via PGPLOT, PLPlot bindings; 3D via GL.

Creator: R Foundation
Notes: Primarily for statistics, but there are many interfaces to open-source numerical software

Creator: William Stein
Notes: Programmable, includes computer algebra, 2D+3D plotting. Interfaces to many open-source software. Web based interface HTTP or HTTPS

Creator: S.Chekanov (jwork.org)
Notes: mathematics, symbolic calculations, algebra, data analysis, data mining, interactive 2D/3D graphics, Java scriptable, used for science and engineering, Cross-platform  (written in Java)

Creator: John E. Davis
Notes: Available as a standalone (slsh) and embedded interpreter (jed, slrn, ...)

Creator: Scilab Enterprises Was:Inria
Notes: Open source, community supported. Programmable, direct support of 2D+3D plotting. Interfaces to many other software packages. Interfacing to external modules written in C, Java, Python or other languages. Language syntax similar to MATLAB. Used for numerical computing in engineering and physics.

Creator: Dipl.-Phys.-Ing. Ralf Wirtz
Notes: interactive graphics, 2D/3D render engine, used for science and engineering, Excel im-/export.

Creator: Normal H. Nie, Dale H. Bent, and C. Hadlai Hull
Universal Technical Systems, Inc.
Notes: Numerical computation and rule-based application development

Creator: Visual Solutions
Notes: Visual Language for simulation and Model Based Design. Used in business, science and engineering. Performs complex scalar or matrix based ODE solving with parametric optimization. Has 2D and 3D plotting, 3D animation, and state transition built in.

Creator: n/a
Notes: Open source. Programmable, callable 2D+3D plotting. Language syntax similar to C. Interfacing to other software packages via C calls.

Notes: Adds numerical programming capabilities to the Python programming language. Related to Numpy, and therefore connected to the previous Numeric and Numarray packages for Python
